stories.text:
I know about git-lfs and mercurial binary files extension, but don't know the pros and cons. Is there something like git, but specialized in binary files?

Apparently SVN could work very well with binary files, but it needs a central server.
stories.title: Ask HN: What VCS to use for binary files only?
Show HN: Backpainfree.org â€“ stackoverflow for back pain problems

stories.text:
If there were a general-purpose OLTP SQL database that was developed today, what features or design decisions would it pick that PostgreSQL and MySQL cannot adapt for historic reasons?

Or put another way, what are some cutting edge database techniques/features/architectures that PostgreSQL and MySQL would have a hard time supporting?
stories.title: Ask HN: What could a modern database do that PostgreSQL and MySQL can't
